column4: hi can someone help i need to run a fsdsk on ubunut 10.10 as the hard drive is making funny noises
have you backed up anything you can't live without on that hd? I'd do that first...
i understand i need to run it from the start, but how do i get  a command line prompt at start up ?
i understand that i cant run it whilst im on gnome
the disk utility has check filesystem and repair but it says drive is busy so i think i need to restart at command line ?
but not sure how to do this
and do you also understand that 'funny noises' from a disk usually mean a hardware failure, something that probably can't be fixed via fsck?
it happened before and i wiped it and started again and it was fine but maybe fsck will do it ?
i have tried shutdown - r F but that did not work
it's worth trying. which disk is it?
it is my only disk the one that the system is mounted on
i suppose i dont know how to start 10.10 in command line and then run the fsk command
tried that it is not working
how do i force 10.10 to go to command line to start with - it always goes to the login screen., 9.04 had options at the start to go to command line
Sorry dunno. I don't run gdm. Can you boot a live cd? That's probably next easiest
cant believe 10.10 does not have the option to start at command line
not sure it would help anyway. You still can't fsck a disk partition while you're running from it...
